page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: {Southminster}grew up around the early{ Saxon Church.It became the principal village in the Dengie Hundred.Its {Weekly Market}served all the villages and the{Railway}terminated here.The{ {Police Station}and{County Court}were built in 1901 and are still in existence today.The{Manor House}in Station Road was destroyed by a bomb in World War II and this event altered the character of Southminster.North Street a busy shopping area was destroyed leaving the High Street to take on the role of the village shopping centre.There are adequate shopping facilities for a small village also outdoor and indoor recreational activities for all ages. The main work available centres round the farms,market gardens and a light industrial estate.Many people commute to towns outside the village.
